item.title: CPython Developer Panel
item.description:
Description

EuroPython 2022 - CPython Developer Panel - presented by ≈Åukasz Langa, Pablo Galindo Salgado, Mark Shannon, Steve Dower, Irit Katriel, Batuhan Taskaya & Ken Jin

[The Auditorium on 2022-07-13]

Come meet the folks who make the Python programming language!

A panel discussion of core Python developers will take place on Wednesday at 2pm. Hear what's on their mind, what they're working on and what the future holds for Python.

With Pablo Galindo Salgado, Steve Dower, Batuhan Taskaya, Ken Jin, Irit Katriel and Dr.Mark ""HotPy"" Shannon. Chaired by the esteemed ≈Åukasz ""Any color you like so long as it's black"" Langa.

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/
item.dc:creator: ≈Åukasz Langa

item.title: How two undergrads from the other side of the planet are speeding up your future code
item.description:
Description

CPython 3.13 is planned to get cool new performance features. One of them is an experimental runtime bytecode optimizer, which will optimize bytecode on the fly using compiler optimizations. It aims to do fancy-sounding things like type propagation, guard elimination, constant promotion and more!

What‚Äôs less known - this optimizer is currently being built by a university undergraduate üò≤, with earlier iterations contributed by another undergrad. We‚Äôre also receiving course credit for it! One of us had no prior experience contributing to CPython.

In this talk, we‚Äôll split our time 60-40, with some time for the performance enthusiasts out there, and the remaining time on our experience contributing to CPython as an (in our opinion) underrepresented group, and how you can contribute to CPython as a university student as well.

You don‚Äôt have to be a compiler or CPython expert to attend ‚Äì this talk is aimed at everyone who can read and write some Python.
item.dc:creator: Ken Jin
